# Day 5 Thread

## Post 1
[DAY 5] of building a Quantum wallet for @Starknet. I built the full Falcon-512 verification in one afternoon â€” types, hash function, signature checking, cross-language tests. Then spent the next afternoon cutting verify() by 60%.

63k steps for the verify function alone. The 230k full budget from Day 1 is comfortably beaten.

https://x.com/feltroidPrime/status/2021250459210743914

---

## Post 2
The hash function was the interesting design problem. Falcon needs to hash a message into 512 coefficients mod 12289. The spec uses SHAKE256 with rejection sampling: extract 16 bits, reject if biased, retry. That's branching and variable-length loops, expensive in a ZK VM.

Blake2s would be ideal â€” native opcode, 2-3x cheaper than Poseidon â€” but I asked @Starkware and it won't be available to contracts until 0.14.2 in April. Poseidon it is.

---

## Post 3
I looked at how @0xMiden does their Falcon with Poseidon2. They skip rejection entirely and extract more bits per coefficient instead. The trick is in the Falcon spec itself (page 31): if your hash output is much larger than q, the modular bias becomes negligible.

With 16-bit inputs some residues get 25% more pre-images than others. With 128-bit inputs the bias is parts per 10^38. A Renyi divergence argument makes it formal. Minimum safe is ~50 bits; we extract from 128. Overkill.

---

## Post 4
So I built base-Q extraction chains. Each Poseidon output is a felt252 â€” 251 bits. Split into a low u128 and a high 124-bit part, then extract coefficients with repeated DivRem-by-q: divide, take remainder, repeat. 6 from each half. 12 coefficients per felt252.

22 Poseidon permutations for all 512 coefficients. No rejection, no branching, no variable-length loops.

> ATTACH: day5_extraction_chain.png

---

## Post 5
The BoundedInt type chains for this are painful though. Each DivRem step needs exact quotient and remainder types. Two separate chains because u128 and FeltHigh have different upper bounds. 40+ type definitions just for the extraction logic.

But the compiler uses those bounds to skip every overflow check. Without BoundedInt each division needs a u256 intermediate and a try_into cast back down â€” doubling the cost. Same lesson from Day 2: the pain pays for itself.

---

## Post 6
I also moved the INTT off-chain. Standard Falcon: NTT the signature, multiply by public key, INTT back, check norm. Three transforms. Instead, the signer computes mul_hint = INTT(NTT(s1) * pk_ntt) and sends it alongside the signature. The verifier just re-checks the forward direction: NTT(mul_hint) == NTT(s1) * pk_ntt.

Two NTTs, zero INTTs.

> ATTACH: day5_verify_flow.png

---

## Post 7
Then I found a free optimization. I originally wrote a custom absorb function for the Poseidon sponge â€” rate-2 absorption, padding, domain separation, the whole thing. Then I realized Cairo's built-in poseidon_hash_span does the exact same thing. Replaced 20 lines with one function call. 33% gas reduction on hash_to_point.

---

## Post 8
The next day I went on an optimization sprint. 8 commits in one afternoon.

The verification had three separate 512-element loops: multiply and check the hint, subtract to get s0, compute both norms. I fused them into a single pass. verify() went from 159k to 63k steps.

> ATTACH: day5_optimization_waterfall.png

---

## Post 9
I also built a companion Rust crate (falcon-rs) with a generic hash trait â€” swap SHAKE256 for Poseidon. It passes NIST's 100 known-answer test vectors for standard Falcon. Same keygen and signing; only the hash changes.

Rust generates all the Cairo test data. Cairo deserializes and checks element-by-element. 27 Cairo tests, 61 Rust tests. https://github.com/feltroidprime/falcon-rs

---

## Post 10
132k steps, down from 800k on Day 1. -83.5%.

Next: wiring this into an actual account contract. __validate__ calls verify, public key in storage packed into 29 felt252 slots, signature + hint in calldata. When Blake2s ships in 0.14.2, @zknoxhq's hash-to-point drops in and we move toward spec-compliant Falcon on a live network. Let's see.

content.thinking:
The verify-hint test at 4158622 has `verify_with_msg_point` = 152,864 steps. But this test runs multiple verifications (it has `test_verify_with_msg_point[557-618]`, `[665-728]`, `[777-835]` â€” three instances at 7,694 each). The total test is 601,680 steps.

Wait â€” looking more carefully, the `falcon::falcon::verify_with_msg_point` shows 152,864 cumulative. But the test function shows 601,680. If the test runs multiple verify calls, the 152,864 might be just one call. 

There's no separate `falcon::falcon::verify` entry in the profile, which makes sense since `test_verify_hint` likely calls `verify_with_msg_point` directly rather than going through the full `verify` function that wraps it with hash_to_point. Looking at the key performance numbers across versions: legacy `verify_uncompressed` was 824,090 steps, then `verify` dropped to 159,422 at ba0471a and stayed around 159,403 at sprint start, with the sprint itself targeting 133,245 steps.

The progression from 117,836 down to 63,177 shows the cumulative impact of optimizations. The massive jump from 824k to 159k came from switching to the hint-based approach with 2 NTTs and 0 INTTs, plus the NTT compiler improvements. For the waterfall visualization, I need to show the legacy baseline, the first hint-based version, and then the sprint progression, but the scale difference is hugeâ€”the sprint bars will look tiny compared to the legacy number. I could either split this into two groups or add a text annotation to make the progression clearer.

Looking back at what the user asked for, they want the cost from "the first time we had this verify function"â€”which is the hint-based `falcon::verify`, not the old `verify_uncompressed`. The first profile of that is at commit ba0471a with a cost of 159,422. There's no real intermediate data point between that and the sprint start since they're essentially the same cost. The 824k was a completely different function from the legacy code. The user might be asking me to show the cost before the poseidon_hash_span optimization, which would require profiling an earlier commit, but that's not straightforward without checking out old code. Let me reconsider what they're actually asking forâ€”they might just want me to include the baseline cost before the optimizations kicked in. I need to figure out what data I actually have access to. The legacy verify_uncompressed at 824,090 cycles is a completely different code path from the hint-based approach, so the gap between that and the 159k figure after the hash_span optimization represents multiple architectural changes bundled together â€” the hint system itself, the compiled NTT from Day 3, and the Poseidon hash-to-point implementation all happening in that initial push.

- `verify` = 159,422

Then Feb 12 has a series of rapid improvementsâ€”converting types, removing intermediates, adjusting allocations, normalizing integersâ€”each one chipping away at the cost until we're down to around 91,213.

Then the final push with the fused compute_norm and fuse all optimizations gets us to 63,177. For the waterfall chart, I'm thinking the clearest story is to show the starting point right after the hash optimization, then each sprint step as a separate bar, so the user can see the cumulative effect of each optimization decision. # Build profiles for both tests at 45e3bcc
for test_name in test_verify_512 test_verify_with_msg_point; do
  trace_file=$(find /tmp/falcon-profile-f1308af -name "*${test_name}*" -path "*/snfoundry_trace/*" 2>/dev/null | head -1)
  if [ -n "$trace_file" ]; then
    outpb="/home/felt/PycharmProjects/s2morrow/profiles/26-02-11-18:00_falcon_${test_name}_steps_45e3bcc.pb.gz"
    cairo-profiler build-profile "$trace_file" --show-libfuncs --output-path "$outpb" 2>&1
    echo "=== $test_name ==="
    cairo-profiler view "$outpb" --sample steps --limit 60 2>&1 | grep -E "verify|hash_to_point" | head -10
    echo
  fi
done

At 45e3bcc:
- `verify_with_msg_point` = 152,883 steps (very close to f1308af's 152,937)
- `verify_uncompressed` (old path) = 390,565
- `intt` (old recursive, used in test) = 247,938

The test_verify_with_msg_point here runs additional things â€” it runs both verify_with_msg_point AND an intt call. This test total is 562,793 which is much more than just verify.

So at the earliest hint-based commit (45e3bcc):


- `verify_with_msg_point` alone = 152,883 (no hash_to_point yet â€” test provides msg_point directly)
- `verify_uncompressed` (old code) = 390,565

But 45e3bcc didn't have a `verify()` function yet, just `verify_with_msg_point`. The `verify` wrapper with hash_to_point came later, so I can't really compare "verify = X" at this commit. I need to focus on what data points are actually available here.

The legacy profile showed verify_uncompressed at 824,090, but at 45e3bcc it's 390,565 â€” that's a significant drop. The difference is that the legacy profile predates the NTT compiler from Day 3, whereas at 45e3bcc the compiled NTT (ntt_512 = 60,484) was already in place. The old recursive NTT (intt = 247,938) was still being used for verify_uncompressed, so the cost decreased from 824k down to 390k as the compiler optimizations took effect.

But the real breakthrough came with the hint-based approach, which eliminated the INTT entirely and dropped verify_uncompressed all the way down to 152k. Now I'm compiling the full timeline of performance metrics across these different versions and approaches.

Looking at the progression from the legacy implementation through the NTT compiler improvements and into the hint-based verification, I can see the dramatic gains at each stage. The sprint data shows a particularly aggressive optimization curve, dropping from 133k down to 63k in a series of improvements. For the waterfall chart, I want to focus on the most impactful milestonesâ€”starting with the initial hint-based verify implementation and then showing how the subsequent optimizations built on that foundation. I'm deciding whether to include the computed f1308af value or stick only to direct profile measurementsâ€”the user asked for exact sources of truth, so the earliest reliable direct measurement is ba0471a at 159,422, which essentially matches the sprint start. The legacy 824k reference line will provide the context for improvement.

I can also layer in the verify_uncompressed measurements to show the NTT compiler's impact: 824k on Day 1 without it, dropping to 390k by Day 3 with it, then the final verify() on Day 5â€”this gives a clearer narrative of the optimization journey. I'm settling on including the legacy verify cost as the first bar for comparisonâ€”the NTT compiler version at 390,565 gives a fair baselineâ€”and then showing the sprint progression from there, with the Day 1 number as a reference point to show how much ground we've covered.

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Image 3: Optimization waterfall
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def generate_optimization_waterfall():
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 7), dpi=DPI)
    fig.patch.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_facecolor(BG)

    # Data â€” verify function cumulative steps from profiled pb.gz at each commit
    labels = [
        "Start",
        "u16 \u2192 Zq\n(BoundedInt)",
        "Remove\nu16/u32",
        "felt252\nalloc fix",
        "BoundedInt\nnorm check",
        "Fuse\nsub+norm\u00b2",
        "Fuse\ncompute_norm",
        "Fuse all\nsingle pass",
    ]
    values = [159_403, 133_245, 117_836, 98_919, 91_213, 87_606, 76_295, 63_177]
    deltas = [""] + [
        f"-{(values[i-1] - values[i]) / values[i-1] * 100:.1f}%"
        for i in range(1, len(values))
    ]

    n = len(values)
    x = np.arange(n)

    # Color gradient: red -> orange -> green
    colors = []
    for i in range(n):
        t = i / (n - 1)
        if t < 0.5:
            # Red to orange
            r = int(0xf7 + (0xff - 0xf7) * (t * 2))
            g = int(0x76 + (0x9e - 0x76) * (t * 2))
            b = int(0x8e + (0x64 - 0x8e) * (t * 2))
        else:
            # Orange to green
            t2 = (t - 0.5) * 2
            r = int(0xff + (0x9e - 0xff) * t2)
            g = int(0x9e + (0xce - 0x9e) * t2)
            b = int(0x64 + (0x6a - 0x64) * t2)
        colors.append(f"#{r:02x}{g:02x}{b:02x}")

    bars = ax.bar(x, values, width=0.65, color=colors, edgecolor="none",
                  alpha=0.9, zorder=3)

    # Value labels on top of each bar
    for i, (val, delta) in enumerate(zip(values, deltas)):
        ax.text(i, val + 3000, f"{val:,}",
                ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=11, fontweight="bold",
                color=WHITE, fontfamily=MONO)
        if delta:
            ax.text(i, val + 9500, delta,
                    ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=9, fontweight="bold",
                    color=colors[i], fontfamily=SANS)

    # Day 1 target line at 230k (total budget, not just verify)
    ax.axhline(y=230_000, color=ACCENT_ORANGE, linewidth=2,
               linestyle="--", alpha=0.85, zorder=4)
    ax.text(n - 0.5, 232_000, "Day 1 full budget: 230k",
            fontsize=11, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_ORANGE,
            ha="right", va="bottom", fontfamily=SANS)

    # Final result annotation
    ax.annotate(
        f"-{(values[0] - values[-1]) / values[0] * 100:.0f}% total",
        xy=(n - 1, values[-1]),
        xytext=(n - 1 + 0.5, values[-1] + 30000),
        fontsize=14, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_GREEN,
        fontfamily=SANS,
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->", color=ACCENT_GREEN, lw=2),
        zorder=6,
        bbox=dict(boxstyle="round,pad=0.3", facecolor="#1a2d1a",
                  edgecolor=ACCENT_GREEN, linewidth=1.2),
    )

    # X axis
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(labels, fontsize=9, fontfamily=SANS, color=DIM_WHITE)

    # Y axis
    ax.set_ylim(0, 270_000)
    ax.set_ylabel("Cairo VM Steps", fontsize=12, color=DIM_WHITE, fontfamily=SANS)

    # Styling
    ax.spines["top"].set_visible(False)
    ax.spines["right"].set_visible(False)

def generate_optimization_waterfall():
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(16, 7.5), dpi=DPI)
    fig.patch.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_facecolor(BG)

    # Data â€” verify function cumulative steps from profiled pb.gz at each commit
    # Sources:
    #   824,090  falcon_512_steps_legacy.pb.gz           verify_uncompressed (Day 1)
    #   390,565  26-02-11-18:00_..._45e3bcc.pb.gz        verify_uncompressed (with NTT compiler)
    #   159,403  26-02-11-20:59_..._4158622.pb.gz        verify (hint-based, sprint start)
    #   133,245  26-02-12-17:13_..._a00d9f5.pb.gz        after u16â†’Zq
    #   117,836  26-02-12-17:33_..._86f1981.pb.gz        after remove u16/u32
    #    98,919  26-02-12-18:00_..._c0e7510.pb.gz        after felt252 alloc fix
    #    91,213  26-02-12-18:15_..._027e3a9.pb.gz        after BoundedInt norm
    #    87,606  26-02-12-18:23_..._5b52758.pb.gz        after fuse sub+normÂ²
    #    76,295  26-02-12-18:29_..._f116483.pb.gz        after fuse compute_norm
    #    63,177  26-02-12-20:11_..._a1f5ed9.pb.gz        after fuse all single pass
    labels = [
        "Day 1\nlegacy",
        "NTT\ncompiler",
        "Hint-based\n(0 INTTs)",
        "u16 \u2192 Zq",
        "Remove\nu16/u32",
        "felt252\nalloc fix",
        "BInt\nnorm",
        "Fuse\nsub+norm\u00b2",
        "Fuse\ncompute_norm",
        "Fuse all\nsingle pass",
    ]
    values = [824_090, 390_565, 159_403, 133_245, 117_836, 98_919, 91_213, 87_606, 76_295, 63_177]

    # Phase markers: 0-1 = prior days, 2 = Day 5 start, 3+ = sprint
    phase_boundary = 3  # index where sprint starts

    deltas = [""] + [
        f"-{(values[i-1] - values[i]) / values[i-1] * 100:.0f}%"
        for i in range(1, len(values))
    ]

    n = len(values)
    x = np.arange(n)

    # Colors: first 3 bars in dimmer tones (prior work), sprint bars gradient red->green
    colors = []
    prior_colors = [ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_ORANGE, ACCENT_CYAN]
    sprint_n = n - phase_boundary
    for i in range(n):
        if i < phase_boundary:
            colors.append(prior_colors[i])
        else:
            t = (i - phase_boundary) / (sprint_n - 1)
            if t < 0.5:
                r = int(0xf7 + (0xff - 0xf7) * (t * 2))
                g = int(0x76 + (0x9e - 0x76) * (t * 2))
                b = int(0x8e + (0x64 - 0x8e) * (t * 2))
            else:
                t2 = (t - 0.5) * 2
                r = int(0xff + (0x9e - 0xff) * t2)
                g = int(0x9e + (0xce - 0x9e) * t2)
                b = int(0x64 + (0x6a - 0x64) * t2)
            colors.append(f"#{r:02x}{g:02x}{b:02x}")

    bars = ax.bar(x, values, width=0.65, color=colors, edgecolor="none",
                  alpha=0.9, zorder=3)

    # Dim the prior-work bars slightly
    for i in range(phase_boundary):
        bars[i].set_alpha(0.55)

    # Value labels on top of each bar
    for i, (val, delta) in enumerate(zip(values, deltas)):
        fontsize_val = 9 if n > 8 else 11
        ax.text(i, val + 8000, f"{val:,}",
                ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=fontsize_val, fontweight="bold",
                color=WHITE, fontfamily=MONO)
        if delta:
            ax.text(i, val + 28000, delta,
                    ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=8, fontweight="bold",
                    color=colors[i], fontfamily=SANS)

    # Phase separator line
    sep_x = phase_boundary - 0.5
    ax.axvline(x=sep_x, color=SEPARATOR, linewidth=1.5, linestyle="--", alpha=0.6, zorder=1)
    ax.text(sep_x - 0.15, values[0] * 0.98, "Days 1-4",
            fontsize=9, color=COMMENT, ha="right", va="top", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")
    ax.text(sep_x + 0.15, values[0] * 0.98, "Day 5 sprint",
            fontsize=9, color=COMMENT, ha="left", va="top", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    # Final result annotation
    ax.annotate(
        f"-{(values[0] - values[-1]) / values[0] * 100:.0f}% total",
        xy=(n - 1, values[-1]),
        xytext=(n - 1 + 0.3, values[-1] + 80000),
        fontsize=14, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_GREEN,
        fontfamily=SANS,
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->", color=ACCENT_GREEN, lw=2),
        zorder=6,
        bbox=dict(boxstyle="round,pad=0.3", facecolor="#1a2d1a",
                  edgecolor=ACCENT_GREEN, linewidth=1.2),
    )

    # X axis
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(labels, fontsize=8, fontfamily=SANS, color=DIM_WHITE)

    # Y axis
    ax.set_ylim(0, 950_000)
    ax.set_ylabel("Cairo VM Steps", fontsize=12, color=DIM_WHITE, fontfamily=SANS)

    # Styling
    ax.spines["top"].set_visible(False)
    ax.spines["right"].set_visible(False)

                g = int(0x76 + (0x9e - 0x76) * (t * 2))
                b = int(0x8e + (0x64 - 0x8e) * (t * 2))
            else:
                t2 = (t - 0.5) * 2
                r = int(0xff + (0x9e - 0xff) * t2)
                g = int(0x9e + (0xce - 0x9e) * t2)
                b = int(0x64 + (0x6a - 0x64) * t2)
            colors.append(f"#{r:02x}{g:02x}{b:02x}")

    bars = ax.bar(x, values, width=0.65, color=colors, edgecolor="none",
                  alpha=0.9, zorder=3)

    # Dim the prior-work bars slightly
    for i in range(phase_boundary):
        bars[i].set_alpha(0.55)

    # Value labels on top of each bar
    for i, (val, delta) in enumerate(zip(values, deltas)):
        fontsize_val = 9 if n > 8 else 11
        ax.text(i, val + 8000, f"{val:,}",
                ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=fontsize_val, fontweight="bold",
                color=WHITE, fontfamily=MONO)
        if delta:
            ax.text(i, val + 28000, delta,
                    ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=8, fontweight="bold",
                    color=colors[i], fontfamily=SANS)

    # Phase separator line
    sep_x = phase_boundary - 0.5
    ax.axvline(x=sep_x, color=SEPARATOR, linewidth=1.5, linestyle="--", alpha=0.6, zorder=1)
    ax.text(sep_x - 0.15, values[0] * 0.98, "Days 1-4",
            fontsize=9, color=COMMENT, ha="right", va="top", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")
    ax.text(sep_x + 0.15, values[0] * 0.98, "Day 5 sprint",
            fontsize=9, color=COMMENT, ha="left", va="top", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    # Final result annotation
    ax.annotate(
        f"-{(values[0] - values[-1]) / values[0] * 100:.0f}% total",
        xy=(n - 1, values[-1]),
        xytext=(n - 1 + 0.3, values[-1] + 80000),
        fontsize=14, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_GREEN,
        fontfamily=SANS,
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->", color=ACCENT_GREEN, lw=2),
        zorder=6,
        bbox=dict(boxstyle="round,pad=0.3", facecolor="#1a2d1a",
                  edgecolor=ACCENT_GREEN, linewidth=1.2),
    )

    # X axis
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(labels, fontsize=8, fontfamily=SANS, color=DIM_WHITE)

    # Y axis
    ax.set_ylim(0, 950_000)
    ax.set_ylabel("Cairo VM Steps", fontsize=12, color=DIM_WHITE, fontfamily=SANS)

    # Styling
    ax.spines["top"].set_visible(False)
    ax.spines["right"].set_visible(False)
toolUseResult.originalFile:
"""
Generate visual assets for Day 5 Twitter thread.

Produces three images:
  1. day5_verify_flow.png       -- Standard vs hint-based verification flow
  2. day5_extraction_chain.png  -- Base-Q DivRem extraction from felt252
  3. day5_optimization_waterfall.png -- Optimization sprint waterfall chart

Usage:
    python scripts/thread/visuals/day5_visuals.py
"""

from __future__ import annotations

from pathlib import Path

import matplotlib
matplotlib.use("Agg")

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.patches import FancyBboxPatch
import numpy as np

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Global palette (Tokyo Night inspired â€” shared with thread_visuals.py)
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
BG = "#1a1b26"
BG_PANEL = "#24283b"
FG = "#c0caf5"
COMMENT = "#565f89"
KEYWORD = "#bb9af7"   # purple
TYPE = "#7dcfff"       # cyan
NUMBER = "#ff9e64"     # orange
STRING = "#9ece6a"     # green
OPERATOR = "#89ddff"   # light cyan
ACCENT_GREEN = "#9ece6a"
ACCENT_CYAN = "#7dcfff"
ACCENT_RED = "#f7768e"
ACCENT_ORANGE = "#ff9e64"
WHITE = "#ffffff"
DIM_WHITE = "#a9b1d6"
SEPARATOR = "#3b4261"

MONO = "DejaVu Sans Mono"
SANS = "DejaVu Sans"

OUTPUT_DIR = Path(__file__).resolve().parent / "day5_output"
DPI = 200


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Helpers (same as thread_visuals.py)
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def _setup_style():
    plt.style.use("dark_background")
    plt.rcParams.update({
        "figure.facecolor": BG,
        "axes.facecolor": BG,
        "savefig.facecolor": BG,
        "text.color": FG,
        "font.family": "sans-serif",
        "font.sans-serif": [SANS],
    })


def _draw_box(ax, cx, cy, w, h, text, facecolor=BG_PANEL, edgecolor=SEPARATOR,
              textcolor=FG, fontsize=9, bold=False, fontfamily=None, alpha=1.0):
    """Draw a rounded box centered at (cx, cy) with text inside."""
    rect = FancyBboxPatch(
        (cx - w / 2, cy - h / 2), w, h,
        boxstyle="round,pad=0.012",
        facecolor=facecolor, edgecolor=edgecolor, linewidth=1.5,
        transform=ax.transData, zorder=3, alpha=alpha,
    )
    ax.add_patch(rect)
    ax.text(
        cx, cy, text, fontsize=fontsize, color=textcolor,
        ha="center", va="center", fontfamily=fontfamily or SANS,
        fontweight="bold" if bold else "normal", zorder=4,
        linespacing=1.3,
    )
    return rect


def _draw_arrow(ax, x1, y1, x2, y2, color=SEPARATOR, lw=1.5):
    """Draw an arrow from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2)."""
    ax.annotate(
        "", xy=(x2, y2), xytext=(x1, y1),
        arrowprops=dict(
            arrowstyle="->,head_width=0.15,head_length=0.1",
            color=color, lw=lw, shrinkA=0, shrinkB=0,
        ),
        zorder=2,
    )


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Image 1: Verification flow â€” Standard vs Hint-based
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def generate_verify_flow():
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(16, 7), dpi=DPI)
    fig.patch.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_xlim(0, 11)
    ax.set_ylim(0, 5.5)
    ax.axis("off")

    # Title
    fig.text(0.5, 0.95, "Verification: Standard vs Hint-Based",
             fontsize=22, fontweight="bold", color=WHITE, ha="center", fontfamily=SANS)

    # --- Shared box parameters ---
    bw = 0.95
    bh = 0.55
    arrow_col = "#545c7e"

    # =====================================================================
    # TOP ROW  (Standard) â€” y = 3.8
    # =====================================================================
    y_top = 3.8

    ax.text(0.25, y_top, "Standard", fontsize=16, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_RED,
            ha="center", va="center", fontfamily=SANS)

    boxes_top = [
        (1.5, "NTT(s1)", "#2d1a1a", ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_ORANGE),
        (2.9, "Multiply", "#2d1a1a", ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_ORANGE),
        (4.3, "INTT", "#2d1a1a", ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_RED),
        (5.7, "Norm\ncheck", "#2d1a1a", ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_ORANGE),
    ]

    for cx, label, fc, ec, tc in boxes_top:
        _draw_box(ax, cx, y_top, bw, bh, label,
                  facecolor=fc, edgecolor=ec, textcolor=tc, fontsize=10, bold=True)

    # Checkmark
    ax.text(6.7, y_top, "\u2713", fontsize=28, color=ACCENT_GREEN,
            ha="center", va="center", fontweight="bold")

    # Arrows
    arrow_pairs_top = [(2.0, 2.4), (3.4, 3.8), (4.8, 5.2)]
    for x1, x2 in arrow_pairs_top:
        _draw_arrow(ax, x1, y_top, x2, y_top, color=arrow_col)
    _draw_arrow(ax, 6.2, y_top, 6.5, y_top, color=arrow_col)

    # "3 transforms" label
    ax.annotate(
        "", xy=(1.5 - bw / 2, y_top + bh / 2 + 0.12),
        xytext=(4.3 + bw / 2, y_top + bh / 2 + 0.12),
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="<->", color=COMMENT, lw=1.2),
        zorder=2,
    )
    ax.text(2.9, y_top + bh / 2 + 0.28, "3 transforms (NTT + Multiply + INTT)",
            fontsize=9, color=ACCENT_ORANGE, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, fontweight="bold")

    # Cross out INTT
    # Draw an X over the INTT box
    x_intt = 4.3
    ax.plot([x_intt - 0.35, x_intt + 0.35], [y_top - 0.22, y_top + 0.22],
            color=ACCENT_RED, linewidth=3, alpha=0.7, zorder=5)
    ax.plot([x_intt - 0.35, x_intt + 0.35], [y_top + 0.22, y_top - 0.22],
            color=ACCENT_RED, linewidth=3, alpha=0.7, zorder=5)

    # =====================================================================
    # BOTTOM ROW (Hint-based) â€” y = 1.5
    # =====================================================================
    y_bot = 1.5

    ax.text(0.25, y_bot, "Hint-\nbased", fontsize=16, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_GREEN,
            ha="center", va="center", fontfamily=SANS)

    boxes_bot = [
        (1.5, "NTT(s1)", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
        (2.9, "Multiply", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
        (4.6, "NTT\n(hint)", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
        (6.0, "Compare", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
        (7.4, "Norm\ncheck", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
    ]

    for cx, label, fc, ec, tc in boxes_bot:
        _draw_box(ax, cx, y_bot, bw, bh, label,
                  facecolor=fc, edgecolor=ec, textcolor=tc, fontsize=10, bold=True)

    # Checkmark
    ax.text(8.4, y_bot, "\u2713", fontsize=28, color=ACCENT_GREEN,
            ha="center", va="center", fontweight="bold")

    # Arrows bottom
    arrow_pairs_bot = [(2.0, 2.4), (3.4, 4.1), (5.1, 5.5), (6.5, 6.9)]
    for x1, x2 in arrow_pairs_bot:
        _draw_arrow(ax, x1, y_bot, x2, y_bot, color=arrow_col)
    _draw_arrow(ax, 7.9, y_bot, 8.2, y_bot, color=arrow_col)

    # "2 NTTs, 0 INTTs" label
    ax.annotate(
        "", xy=(1.5 - bw / 2, y_bot + bh / 2 + 0.12),
        xytext=(4.6 + bw / 2, y_bot + bh / 2 + 0.12),
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="<->", color=COMMENT, lw=1.2),
        zorder=2,
    )
    ax.text(3.05, y_bot + bh / 2 + 0.28, "2 NTTs, 0 INTTs",
            fontsize=9, color=ACCENT_GREEN, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, fontweight="bold")

    # "provided by signer" annotation on NTT(hint)
    ax.annotate(
        "hint provided\nby signer",
        xy=(4.6, y_bot - bh / 2 - 0.05),
        xytext=(4.6, y_bot - bh / 2 - 0.65),
        fontsize=9, fontweight="bold", color=KEYWORD, fontfamily=SANS,
        ha="center", va="top",
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->", color=KEYWORD, lw=1.5),
        zorder=5,
    )

    # --- Horizontal separator ---
    ax.plot([0.3, 10.7], [2.7, 2.7], color=SEPARATOR, linewidth=1,
            linestyle="--", alpha=0.5, zorder=1)

    # --- Callout box ---
    ax.text(9.0, 2.7, "Saves ~15k steps\nby moving INTT off-chain",
            fontsize=12, color=ACCENT_GREEN, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, style="italic",
            bbox=dict(boxstyle="round,pad=0.4", facecolor="#1a2d1a",
                      edgecolor=ACCENT_GREEN, linewidth=1.2, alpha=0.8))

    out = OUTPUT_DIR / "day5_verify_flow.png"
    fig.savefig(out, dpi=DPI, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.15)
    plt.close(fig)
    print(f"  Saved {out}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Image 2: Base-Q extraction chain
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def generate_extraction_chain():
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 9), dpi=DPI)
    fig.patch.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_xlim(0, 10)
    ax.set_ylim(0, 10)
    ax.axis("off")

    # Title
    fig.text(0.5, 0.96, "Base-Q Extraction: felt252 to Zq Coefficients",
             fontsize=22, fontweight="bold", color=WHITE, ha="center", fontfamily=SANS)

    # --- Top: felt252 ---
    _draw_box(ax, 5.0, 9.0, 3.5, 0.65, "felt252  (251 bits)",
              facecolor=BG_PANEL, edgecolor=ACCENT_CYAN, textcolor=ACCENT_CYAN,
              fontsize=13, bold=True)

    # Split arrow down
    _draw_arrow(ax, 5.0, 8.65, 5.0, 8.15, color=DIM_WHITE, lw=2)
    ax.text(5.6, 8.4, "split", fontsize=10, color=DIM_WHITE, ha="left",
            fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    # --- Two branches ---
    # Left: u128
    left_x = 3.0
    _draw_box(ax, left_x, 7.8, 2.5, 0.55, "u128  (128 bits)",
              facecolor=BG_PANEL, edgecolor=ACCENT_CYAN, textcolor=ACCENT_CYAN,
              fontsize=11, bold=True)

    # Right: FeltHigh
    right_x = 7.0
    _draw_box(ax, right_x, 7.8, 2.5, 0.55, "FeltHigh  (124 bits)",
              facecolor=BG_PANEL, edgecolor=ACCENT_ORANGE, textcolor=ACCENT_ORANGE,
              fontsize=11, bold=True)

    # Fork arrows from split point
    _draw_arrow(ax, 4.2, 8.1, left_x + 0.3, 8.1, color=DIM_WHITE, lw=1.5)
    _draw_arrow(ax, 5.8, 8.1, right_x - 0.3, 8.1, color=DIM_WHITE, lw=1.5)

    # --- DivRem chains ---
    divrem_y_start = 7.15
    divrem_step = 0.72

    for branch_x, branch_color, branch_label, bits_left, discard_bits in [
        (left_x, ACCENT_CYAN, "u128", 128, 47),
        (right_x, ACCENT_ORANGE, "FeltHigh", 124, 42),
    ]:
        for i in range(6):
            y = divrem_y_start - i * divrem_step
            remaining = bits_left - (i + 1) * 14  # ~14 bits per q

            # DivRem box
            box_label = f"DivRem-by-q #{i+1}"
            _draw_box(ax, branch_x, y, 2.2, 0.45, box_label,
                      facecolor="#1a2420" if branch_color == ACCENT_CYAN else "#2d2a1a",
                      edgecolor=branch_color, textcolor=branch_color,
                      fontsize=8.5, bold=False)

            # Coefficient output arrow (right side)
            coeff_x = branch_x + 1.4
            ax.text(coeff_x, y, f"\u2192 Zq", fontsize=8, color=ACCENT_GREEN,
                    ha="left", va="center", fontfamily=MONO, fontweight="bold")

            # Arrow to next step
            if i < 5:
                _draw_arrow(ax, branch_x, y - 0.23, branch_x, y - 0.49,
                            color="#545c7e")

        # Discard remainder
        y_discard = divrem_y_start - 6 * divrem_step + 0.1
        discard_rect = FancyBboxPatch(
            (branch_x - 1.1, y_discard - 0.22), 2.2, 0.38,
            boxstyle="round,pad=0.01",
            facecolor=ACCENT_RED, edgecolor="none", alpha=0.12,
            transform=ax.transData, zorder=1,
        )
        ax.add_patch(discard_rect)
        ax.text(branch_x, y_discard, f"remainder ({discard_bits} bits)\ndiscarded",
                fontsize=8, color=ACCENT_RED, ha="center", va="center",
                fontfamily=SANS, style="italic", alpha=0.9)

    # --- Bottom summary ---
    ax.text(5.0, 1.6,
            "12 coefficients per felt252",
            fontsize=14, color=WHITE, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, fontweight="bold")
    ax.text(5.0, 1.1,
            "22 Poseidon permutations = 512+ coefficients",
            fontsize=12, color=DIM_WHITE, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS)
    ax.text(5.0, 0.6,
            "No rejection sampling.  No branching.  No variable-length loops.",
            fontsize=11, color=ACCENT_GREEN, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    # --- Red zone explanation ---
    ax.text(5.0, 2.2,
            "Remainders < 50 bits: too small to safely extract another coefficient",
            fontsize=9, color=ACCENT_RED, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, style="italic", alpha=0.8)

    out = OUTPUT_DIR / "day5_extraction_chain.png"
    fig.savefig(out, dpi=DPI, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.15)
    plt.close(fig)
    print(f"  Saved {out}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Image 3: Optimization waterfall
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def generate_optimization_waterfall():
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 7), dpi=DPI)
    fig.patch.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_facecolor(BG)

    # Data â€” verify function cumulative steps from profiled pb.gz at each commit
    labels = [
        "Start",
        "u16 \u2192 Zq\n(BoundedInt)",
        "Remove\nu16/u32",
        "felt252\nalloc fix",
        "BoundedInt\nnorm check",
        "Fuse\nsub+norm\u00b2",
        "Fuse\ncompute_norm",
        "Fuse all\nsingle pass",
    ]
    values = [159_403, 133_245, 117_836, 98_919, 91_213, 87_606, 76_295, 63_177]
    deltas = [""] + [
        f"-{(values[i-1] - values[i]) / values[i-1] * 100:.1f}%"
        for i in range(1, len(values))
    ]

    n = len(values)
    x = np.arange(n)

    # Color gradient: red -> orange -> green
    colors = []
    for i in range(n):
        t = i / (n - 1)
        if t < 0.5:
            # Red to orange
            r = int(0xf7 + (0xff - 0xf7) * (t * 2))
            g = int(0x76 + (0x9e - 0x76) * (t * 2))
            b = int(0x8e + (0x64 - 0x8e) * (t * 2))
        else:
            # Orange to green
            t2 = (t - 0.5) * 2
            r = int(0xff + (0x9e - 0xff) * t2)
            g = int(0x9e + (0xce - 0x9e) * t2)
            b = int(0x64 + (0x6a - 0x64) * t2)
        colors.append(f"#{r:02x}{g:02x}{b:02x}")

    bars = ax.bar(x, values, width=0.65, color=colors, edgecolor="none",
                  alpha=0.9, zorder=3)

    # Value labels on top of each bar
    for i, (val, delta) in enumerate(zip(values, deltas)):
        ax.text(i, val + 3000, f"{val:,}",
                ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=11, fontweight="bold",
                color=WHITE, fontfamily=MONO)
        if delta:
            ax.text(i, val + 9500, delta,
                    ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=9, fontweight="bold",
                    color=colors[i], fontfamily=SANS)

    # Day 1 target line at 230k (total budget, not just verify)
    ax.axhline(y=230_000, color=ACCENT_ORANGE, linewidth=2,
               linestyle="--", alpha=0.85, zorder=4)
    ax.text(n - 0.5, 232_000, "Day 1 full budget: 230k",
            fontsize=11, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_ORANGE,
            ha="right", va="bottom", fontfamily=SANS)

    # Final result annotation
    ax.annotate(
        f"-{(values[0] - values[-1]) / values[0] * 100:.0f}% total",
        xy=(n - 1, values[-1]),
        xytext=(n - 1 + 0.5, values[-1] + 30000),
        fontsize=14, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_GREEN,
        fontfamily=SANS,
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->", color=ACCENT_GREEN, lw=2),
        zorder=6,
        bbox=dict(boxstyle="round,pad=0.3", facecolor="#1a2d1a",
                  edgecolor=ACCENT_GREEN, linewidth=1.2),
    )

    # X axis
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(labels, fontsize=9, fontfamily=SANS, color=DIM_WHITE)

    # Y axis
    ax.set_ylim(0, 270_000)
    ax.set_ylabel("Cairo VM Steps", fontsize=12, color=DIM_WHITE, fontfamily=SANS)

    # Styling
    ax.spines["top"].set_visible(False)
    ax.spines["right"].set_visible(False)
    ax.spines["bottom"].set_color(SEPARATOR)
    ax.spines["left"].set_color(SEPARATOR)
    ax.tick_params(axis="y", colors=COMMENT, labelsize=10)
    ax.grid(axis="y", color=SEPARATOR, alpha=0.3, linewidth=0.5)

    # Title
    fig.text(0.5, 0.97, "verify() Optimization: 159k \u2192 63k Steps",
             fontsize=22, fontweight="bold", color=WHITE, ha="center", fontfamily=SANS)
    fig.text(0.5, 0.93, "8 commits, one afternoon",
             fontsize=13, color=COMMENT, ha="center", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    out = OUTPUT_DIR / "day5_optimization_waterfall.png"
    fig.savefig(out, dpi=DPI, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.2)
    plt.close(fig)
    print(f"  Saved {out}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Main
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def main():
    _setup_style()
    OUTPUT_DIR.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    print("Generating Day 5 thread visuals...")
    generate_verify_flow()
    generate_extraction_chain()
    generate_optimization_waterfall()
    print("Done!")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

+            fontsize=9, color=COMMENT, ha="left", va="top", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

toolUseResult.originalFile:
"""
Generate visual assets for Day 5 Twitter thread.

Produces three images:
  1. day5_verify_flow.png       -- Standard vs hint-based verification flow
  2. day5_extraction_chain.png  -- Base-Q DivRem extraction from felt252
  3. day5_optimization_waterfall.png -- Optimization sprint waterfall chart

Usage:
    python scripts/thread/visuals/day5_visuals.py
"""

from __future__ import annotations

from pathlib import Path

import matplotlib
matplotlib.use("Agg")

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.patches import FancyBboxPatch
import numpy as np

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Global palette (Tokyo Night inspired â€” shared with thread_visuals.py)
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
BG = "#1a1b26"
BG_PANEL = "#24283b"
FG = "#c0caf5"
COMMENT = "#565f89"
KEYWORD = "#bb9af7"   # purple
TYPE = "#7dcfff"       # cyan
NUMBER = "#ff9e64"     # orange
STRING = "#9ece6a"     # green
OPERATOR = "#89ddff"   # light cyan
ACCENT_GREEN = "#9ece6a"
ACCENT_CYAN = "#7dcfff"
ACCENT_RED = "#f7768e"
ACCENT_ORANGE = "#ff9e64"
WHITE = "#ffffff"
DIM_WHITE = "#a9b1d6"
SEPARATOR = "#3b4261"

MONO = "DejaVu Sans Mono"
SANS = "DejaVu Sans"

OUTPUT_DIR = Path(__file__).resolve().parent / "day5_output"
DPI = 200


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Helpers (same as thread_visuals.py)
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def _setup_style():
    plt.style.use("dark_background")
    plt.rcParams.update({
        "figure.facecolor": BG,
        "axes.facecolor": BG,
        "savefig.facecolor": BG,
        "text.color": FG,
        "font.family": "sans-serif",
        "font.sans-serif": [SANS],
    })


def _draw_box(ax, cx, cy, w, h, text, facecolor=BG_PANEL, edgecolor=SEPARATOR,
              textcolor=FG, fontsize=9, bold=False, fontfamily=None, alpha=1.0):
    """Draw a rounded box centered at (cx, cy) with text inside."""
    rect = FancyBboxPatch(
        (cx - w / 2, cy - h / 2), w, h,
        boxstyle="round,pad=0.012",
        facecolor=facecolor, edgecolor=edgecolor, linewidth=1.5,
        transform=ax.transData, zorder=3, alpha=alpha,
    )
    ax.add_patch(rect)
    ax.text(
        cx, cy, text, fontsize=fontsize, color=textcolor,
        ha="center", va="center", fontfamily=fontfamily or SANS,
        fontweight="bold" if bold else "normal", zorder=4,
        linespacing=1.3,
    )
    return rect


def _draw_arrow(ax, x1, y1, x2, y2, color=SEPARATOR, lw=1.5):
    """Draw an arrow from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2)."""
    ax.annotate(
        "", xy=(x2, y2), xytext=(x1, y1),
        arrowprops=dict(
            arrowstyle="->,head_width=0.15,head_length=0.1",
            color=color, lw=lw, shrinkA=0, shrinkB=0,
        ),
        zorder=2,
    )


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Image 1: Verification flow â€” Standard vs Hint-based
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def generate_verify_flow():
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(16, 7), dpi=DPI)
    fig.patch.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_xlim(0, 11)
    ax.set_ylim(0, 5.5)
    ax.axis("off")

    # Title
    fig.text(0.5, 0.95, "Verification: Standard vs Hint-Based",
             fontsize=22, fontweight="bold", color=WHITE, ha="center", fontfamily=SANS)

    # --- Shared box parameters ---
    bw = 0.95
    bh = 0.55
    arrow_col = "#545c7e"

    # =====================================================================
    # TOP ROW  (Standard) â€” y = 3.8
    # =====================================================================
    y_top = 3.8

    ax.text(0.25, y_top, "Standard", fontsize=16, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_RED,
            ha="center", va="center", fontfamily=SANS)

    boxes_top = [
        (1.5, "NTT(s1)", "#2d1a1a", ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_ORANGE),
        (2.9, "Multiply", "#2d1a1a", ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_ORANGE),
        (4.3, "INTT", "#2d1a1a", ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_RED),
        (5.7, "Norm\ncheck", "#2d1a1a", ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_ORANGE),
    ]

    for cx, label, fc, ec, tc in boxes_top:
        _draw_box(ax, cx, y_top, bw, bh, label,
                  facecolor=fc, edgecolor=ec, textcolor=tc, fontsize=10, bold=True)

    # Checkmark
    ax.text(6.7, y_top, "\u2713", fontsize=28, color=ACCENT_GREEN,
            ha="center", va="center", fontweight="bold")

    # Arrows
    arrow_pairs_top = [(2.0, 2.4), (3.4, 3.8), (4.8, 5.2)]
    for x1, x2 in arrow_pairs_top:
        _draw_arrow(ax, x1, y_top, x2, y_top, color=arrow_col)
    _draw_arrow(ax, 6.2, y_top, 6.5, y_top, color=arrow_col)

    # "3 transforms" label
    ax.annotate(
        "", xy=(1.5 - bw / 2, y_top + bh / 2 + 0.12),
        xytext=(4.3 + bw / 2, y_top + bh / 2 + 0.12),
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="<->", color=COMMENT, lw=1.2),
        zorder=2,
    )
    ax.text(2.9, y_top + bh / 2 + 0.28, "3 transforms (NTT + Multiply + INTT)",
            fontsize=9, color=ACCENT_ORANGE, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, fontweight="bold")

    # Cross out INTT
    # Draw an X over the INTT box
    x_intt = 4.3
    ax.plot([x_intt - 0.35, x_intt + 0.35], [y_top - 0.22, y_top + 0.22],
            color=ACCENT_RED, linewidth=3, alpha=0.7, zorder=5)
    ax.plot([x_intt - 0.35, x_intt + 0.35], [y_top + 0.22, y_top - 0.22],
            color=ACCENT_RED, linewidth=3, alpha=0.7, zorder=5)

    # =====================================================================
    # BOTTOM ROW (Hint-based) â€” y = 1.5
    # =====================================================================
    y_bot = 1.5

    ax.text(0.25, y_bot, "Hint-\nbased", fontsize=16, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_GREEN,
            ha="center", va="center", fontfamily=SANS)

    boxes_bot = [
        (1.5, "NTT(s1)", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
        (2.9, "Multiply", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
        (4.6, "NTT\n(hint)", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
        (6.0, "Compare", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
        (7.4, "Norm\ncheck", "#1a2d1a", ACCENT_GREEN, ACCENT_CYAN),
    ]

    for cx, label, fc, ec, tc in boxes_bot:
        _draw_box(ax, cx, y_bot, bw, bh, label,
                  facecolor=fc, edgecolor=ec, textcolor=tc, fontsize=10, bold=True)

    # Checkmark
    ax.text(8.4, y_bot, "\u2713", fontsize=28, color=ACCENT_GREEN,
            ha="center", va="center", fontweight="bold")

    # Arrows bottom
    arrow_pairs_bot = [(2.0, 2.4), (3.4, 4.1), (5.1, 5.5), (6.5, 6.9)]
    for x1, x2 in arrow_pairs_bot:
        _draw_arrow(ax, x1, y_bot, x2, y_bot, color=arrow_col)
    _draw_arrow(ax, 7.9, y_bot, 8.2, y_bot, color=arrow_col)

    # "2 NTTs, 0 INTTs" label
    ax.annotate(
        "", xy=(1.5 - bw / 2, y_bot + bh / 2 + 0.12),
        xytext=(4.6 + bw / 2, y_bot + bh / 2 + 0.12),
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="<->", color=COMMENT, lw=1.2),
        zorder=2,
    )
    ax.text(3.05, y_bot + bh / 2 + 0.28, "2 NTTs, 0 INTTs",
            fontsize=9, color=ACCENT_GREEN, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, fontweight="bold")

    # "provided by signer" annotation on NTT(hint)
    ax.annotate(
        "hint provided\nby signer",
        xy=(4.6, y_bot - bh / 2 - 0.05),
        xytext=(4.6, y_bot - bh / 2 - 0.65),
        fontsize=9, fontweight="bold", color=KEYWORD, fontfamily=SANS,
        ha="center", va="top",
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->", color=KEYWORD, lw=1.5),
        zorder=5,
    )

    # --- Horizontal separator ---
    ax.plot([0.3, 10.7], [2.7, 2.7], color=SEPARATOR, linewidth=1,
            linestyle="--", alpha=0.5, zorder=1)

    # --- Callout box ---
    ax.text(9.0, 2.7, "Saves ~15k steps\nby moving INTT off-chain",
            fontsize=12, color=ACCENT_GREEN, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, style="italic",
            bbox=dict(boxstyle="round,pad=0.4", facecolor="#1a2d1a",
                      edgecolor=ACCENT_GREEN, linewidth=1.2, alpha=0.8))

    out = OUTPUT_DIR / "day5_verify_flow.png"
    fig.savefig(out, dpi=DPI, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.15)
    plt.close(fig)
    print(f"  Saved {out}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Image 2: Base-Q extraction chain
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def generate_extraction_chain():
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 9), dpi=DPI)
    fig.patch.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_xlim(0, 10)
    ax.set_ylim(0, 10)
    ax.axis("off")

    # Title
    fig.text(0.5, 0.96, "Base-Q Extraction: felt252 to Zq Coefficients",
             fontsize=22, fontweight="bold", color=WHITE, ha="center", fontfamily=SANS)

    # --- Top: felt252 ---
    _draw_box(ax, 5.0, 9.0, 3.5, 0.65, "felt252  (251 bits)",
              facecolor=BG_PANEL, edgecolor=ACCENT_CYAN, textcolor=ACCENT_CYAN,
              fontsize=13, bold=True)

    # Split arrow down
    _draw_arrow(ax, 5.0, 8.65, 5.0, 8.15, color=DIM_WHITE, lw=2)
    ax.text(5.6, 8.4, "split", fontsize=10, color=DIM_WHITE, ha="left",
            fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    # --- Two branches ---
    # Left: u128
    left_x = 3.0
    _draw_box(ax, left_x, 7.8, 2.5, 0.55, "u128  (128 bits)",
              facecolor=BG_PANEL, edgecolor=ACCENT_CYAN, textcolor=ACCENT_CYAN,
              fontsize=11, bold=True)

    # Right: FeltHigh
    right_x = 7.0
    _draw_box(ax, right_x, 7.8, 2.5, 0.55, "FeltHigh  (124 bits)",
              facecolor=BG_PANEL, edgecolor=ACCENT_ORANGE, textcolor=ACCENT_ORANGE,
              fontsize=11, bold=True)

    # Fork arrows from split point
    _draw_arrow(ax, 4.2, 8.1, left_x + 0.3, 8.1, color=DIM_WHITE, lw=1.5)
    _draw_arrow(ax, 5.8, 8.1, right_x - 0.3, 8.1, color=DIM_WHITE, lw=1.5)

    # --- DivRem chains ---
    divrem_y_start = 7.15
    divrem_step = 0.72

    for branch_x, branch_color, branch_label, bits_left, discard_bits in [
        (left_x, ACCENT_CYAN, "u128", 128, 47),
        (right_x, ACCENT_ORANGE, "FeltHigh", 124, 42),
    ]:
        for i in range(6):
            y = divrem_y_start - i * divrem_step
            remaining = bits_left - (i + 1) * 14  # ~14 bits per q

            # DivRem box
            box_label = f"DivRem-by-q #{i+1}"
            _draw_box(ax, branch_x, y, 2.2, 0.45, box_label,
                      facecolor="#1a2420" if branch_color == ACCENT_CYAN else "#2d2a1a",
                      edgecolor=branch_color, textcolor=branch_color,
                      fontsize=8.5, bold=False)

            # Coefficient output arrow (right side)
            coeff_x = branch_x + 1.4
            ax.text(coeff_x, y, f"\u2192 Zq", fontsize=8, color=ACCENT_GREEN,
                    ha="left", va="center", fontfamily=MONO, fontweight="bold")

            # Arrow to next step
            if i < 5:
                _draw_arrow(ax, branch_x, y - 0.23, branch_x, y - 0.49,
                            color="#545c7e")

        # Discard remainder
        y_discard = divrem_y_start - 6 * divrem_step + 0.1
        discard_rect = FancyBboxPatch(
            (branch_x - 1.1, y_discard - 0.22), 2.2, 0.38,
            boxstyle="round,pad=0.01",
            facecolor=ACCENT_RED, edgecolor="none", alpha=0.12,
            transform=ax.transData, zorder=1,
        )
        ax.add_patch(discard_rect)
        ax.text(branch_x, y_discard, f"remainder ({discard_bits} bits)\ndiscarded",
                fontsize=8, color=ACCENT_RED, ha="center", va="center",
                fontfamily=SANS, style="italic", alpha=0.9)

    # --- Bottom summary ---
    ax.text(5.0, 1.6,
            "12 coefficients per felt252",
            fontsize=14, color=WHITE, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, fontweight="bold")
    ax.text(5.0, 1.1,
            "22 Poseidon permutations = 512+ coefficients",
            fontsize=12, color=DIM_WHITE, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS)
    ax.text(5.0, 0.6,
            "No rejection sampling.  No branching.  No variable-length loops.",
            fontsize=11, color=ACCENT_GREEN, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    # --- Red zone explanation ---
    ax.text(5.0, 2.2,
            "Remainders < 50 bits: too small to safely extract another coefficient",
            fontsize=9, color=ACCENT_RED, ha="center", va="center",
            fontfamily=SANS, style="italic", alpha=0.8)

    out = OUTPUT_DIR / "day5_extraction_chain.png"
    fig.savefig(out, dpi=DPI, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.15)
    plt.close(fig)
    print(f"  Saved {out}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Image 3: Optimization waterfall
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def generate_optimization_waterfall():
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(16, 7.5), dpi=DPI)
    fig.patch.set_facecolor(BG)
    ax.set_facecolor(BG)

    # Data â€” verify function cumulative steps from profiled pb.gz at each commit
    # Sources:
    #   824,090  falcon_512_steps_legacy.pb.gz           verify_uncompressed (Day 1)
    #   390,565  26-02-11-18:00_..._45e3bcc.pb.gz        verify_uncompressed (with NTT compiler)
    #   159,403  26-02-11-20:59_..._4158622.pb.gz        verify (hint-based, sprint start)
    #   133,245  26-02-12-17:13_..._a00d9f5.pb.gz        after u16â†’Zq
    #   117,836  26-02-12-17:33_..._86f1981.pb.gz        after remove u16/u32
    #    98,919  26-02-12-18:00_..._c0e7510.pb.gz        after felt252 alloc fix
    #    91,213  26-02-12-18:15_..._027e3a9.pb.gz        after BoundedInt norm
    #    87,606  26-02-12-18:23_..._5b52758.pb.gz        after fuse sub+normÂ²
    #    76,295  26-02-12-18:29_..._f116483.pb.gz        after fuse compute_norm
    #    63,177  26-02-12-20:11_..._a1f5ed9.pb.gz        after fuse all single pass
    labels = [
        "Day 1\nlegacy",
        "NTT\ncompiler",
        "Hint-based\n(0 INTTs)",
        "u16 \u2192 Zq",
        "Remove\nu16/u32",
        "felt252\nalloc fix",
        "BInt\nnorm",
        "Fuse\nsub+norm\u00b2",
        "Fuse\ncompute_norm",
        "Fuse all\nsingle pass",
    ]
    values = [824_090, 390_565, 159_403, 133_245, 117_836, 98_919, 91_213, 87_606, 76_295, 63_177]

    # Phase markers: 0-1 = prior days, 2 = Day 5 start, 3+ = sprint
    phase_boundary = 3  # index where sprint starts

    deltas = [""] + [
        f"-{(values[i-1] - values[i]) / values[i-1] * 100:.0f}%"
        for i in range(1, len(values))
    ]

    n = len(values)
    x = np.arange(n)

    # Colors: first 3 bars in dimmer tones (prior work), sprint bars gradient red->green
    colors = []
    prior_colors = [ACCENT_RED, ACCENT_ORANGE, ACCENT_CYAN]
    sprint_n = n - phase_boundary
    for i in range(n):
        if i < phase_boundary:
            colors.append(prior_colors[i])
        else:
            t = (i - phase_boundary) / (sprint_n - 1)
            if t < 0.5:
                r = int(0xf7 + (0xff - 0xf7) * (t * 2))
                g = int(0x76 + (0x9e - 0x76) * (t * 2))
                b = int(0x8e + (0x64 - 0x8e) * (t * 2))
            else:
                t2 = (t - 0.5) * 2
                r = int(0xff + (0x9e - 0xff) * t2)
                g = int(0x9e + (0xce - 0x9e) * t2)
                b = int(0x64 + (0x6a - 0x64) * t2)
            colors.append(f"#{r:02x}{g:02x}{b:02x}")

    bars = ax.bar(x, values, width=0.65, color=colors, edgecolor="none",
                  alpha=0.9, zorder=3)

    # Dim the prior-work bars slightly
    for i in range(phase_boundary):
        bars[i].set_alpha(0.55)

    # Value labels on top of each bar
    for i, (val, delta) in enumerate(zip(values, deltas)):
        fontsize_val = 9 if n > 8 else 11
        ax.text(i, val + 8000, f"{val:,}",
                ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=fontsize_val, fontweight="bold",
                color=WHITE, fontfamily=MONO)
        if delta:
            ax.text(i, val + 28000, delta,
                    ha="center", va="bottom", fontsize=8, fontweight="bold",
                    color=colors[i], fontfamily=SANS)

    # Phase separator line
    sep_x = phase_boundary - 0.5
    ax.axvline(x=sep_x, color=SEPARATOR, linewidth=1.5, linestyle="--", alpha=0.6, zorder=1)
    ax.text(sep_x - 0.15, values[0] * 0.98, "Days 1-4",
            fontsize=9, color=COMMENT, ha="right", va="top", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")
    ax.text(sep_x + 0.15, values[0] * 0.98, "Day 5 sprint",
            fontsize=9, color=COMMENT, ha="left", va="top", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    # Final result annotation
    ax.annotate(
        f"-{(values[0] - values[-1]) / values[0] * 100:.0f}% total",
        xy=(n - 1, values[-1]),
        xytext=(n - 1 + 0.3, values[-1] + 80000),
        fontsize=14, fontweight="bold", color=ACCENT_GREEN,
        fontfamily=SANS,
        arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->", color=ACCENT_GREEN, lw=2),
        zorder=6,
        bbox=dict(boxstyle="round,pad=0.3", facecolor="#1a2d1a",
                  edgecolor=ACCENT_GREEN, linewidth=1.2),
    )

    # X axis
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(labels, fontsize=8, fontfamily=SANS, color=DIM_WHITE)

    # Y axis
    ax.set_ylim(0, 950_000)
    ax.set_ylabel("Cairo VM Steps", fontsize=12, color=DIM_WHITE, fontfamily=SANS)

    # Styling
    ax.spines["top"].set_visible(False)
    ax.spines["right"].set_visible(False)
    ax.spines["bottom"].set_color(SEPARATOR)
    ax.spines["left"].set_color(SEPARATOR)
    ax.tick_params(axis="y", colors=COMMENT, labelsize=10)
    ax.grid(axis="y", color=SEPARATOR, alpha=0.3, linewidth=0.5)

    # Title
    fig.text(0.5, 0.97, "verify() Optimization: 159k \u2192 63k Steps",
             fontsize=22, fontweight="bold", color=WHITE, ha="center", fontfamily=SANS)
    fig.text(0.5, 0.93, "8 commits, one afternoon",
             fontsize=13, color=COMMENT, ha="center", fontfamily=SANS, style="italic")

    out = OUTPUT_DIR / "day5_optimization_waterfall.png"
    fig.savefig(out, dpi=DPI, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.2)
    plt.close(fig)
    print(f"  Saved {out}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Main
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

def main():
    _setup_style()
    OUTPUT_DIR.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    print("Generating Day 5 thread visuals...")
    generate_verify_flow()
    generate_extraction_chain()
    generate_optimization_waterfall()
    print("Done!")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Day 5 Thread

## Post 1
[DAY 5] of building a Quantum wallet for @Starknet. I built the full Falcon-512 verification in one afternoon â€” types, hash function, signature checking, cross-language tests. Then spent the next afternoon cutting verify() by 60%.

63k steps for the verify function alone. The 230k full budget from Day 1 is comfortably beaten.

https://x.com/feltroidPrime/status/2021250459210743914

---

## Post 2
The hash function was the interesting design problem. Falcon needs to hash a message into 512 coefficients mod 12289. The spec uses SHAKE256 with rejection sampling: extract 16 bits, reject if biased, retry. That's branching and variable-length loops, expensive in a ZK VM.

Blake2s would be ideal â€” native opcode, 2-3x cheaper than Poseidon â€” but I asked @Starkware and it won't be available to contracts until 0.14.2 in April. Poseidon it is.

---

## Post 3
I looked at how @0xMiden does their Falcon with Poseidon2. They skip rejection entirely and extract more bits per coefficient instead. The trick is in the Falcon spec itself (page 31): if your hash output is much larger than q, the modular bias becomes negligible.

With 16-bit inputs some residues get 25% more pre-images than others. With 128-bit inputs the bias is parts per 10^38. A Renyi divergence argument makes it formal. Minimum safe is ~50 bits; we extract from 128. Overkill.

---

## Post 4
So I built base-Q extraction chains. Each Poseidon output is a felt252 â€” 251 bits. Split into a low u128 and a high 124-bit part, then extract coefficients with repeated DivRem-by-q: divide, take remainder, repeat. 6 from each half. 12 coefficients per felt252.

22 Poseidon permutations for all 512 coefficients. No rejection, no branching, no variable-length loops.

> ATTACH: day5_extraction_chain.png

---

## Post 5
The BoundedInt type chains for this are painful though. Each DivRem step needs exact quotient and remainder types. Two separate chains because u128 and FeltHigh have different upper bounds. 40+ type definitions just for the extraction logic.

But the compiler uses those bounds to skip every overflow check. Without BoundedInt each division needs a u256 intermediate and a try_into cast back down â€” doubling the cost. Same lesson from Day 2: the pain pays for itself.

---

## Post 6
I also moved the INTT off-chain. Standard Falcon: NTT the signature, multiply by public key, INTT back, check norm. Three transforms. Instead, the signer computes mul_hint = INTT(NTT(s1) * pk_ntt) and sends it alongside the signature. The verifier just re-checks the forward direction: NTT(mul_hint) == NTT(s1) * pk_ntt.

Two NTTs, zero INTTs.

> ATTACH: day5_verify_flow.png

---

## Post 7
Then I found a free optimization. I originally wrote a custom absorb function for the Poseidon sponge â€” rate-2 absorption, padding, domain separation, the whole thing. Then I realized Cairo's built-in poseidon_hash_span does the exact same thing. Replaced 20 lines with one function call. 33% gas reduction on hash_to_point.

---

## Post 8
The next day I went on an optimization sprint. 8 commits in one afternoon.

The verification had three separate 512-element loops: multiply and check the hint, subtract to get s0, compute both norms. I fused them into a single pass. verify() went from 159k to 63k steps.

> ATTACH: day5_optimization_waterfall.png

---

## Post 9
I also built a companion Rust crate (falcon-rs) with a generic hash trait â€” swap SHAKE256 for Poseidon. It passes NIST's 100 known-answer test vectors for standard Falcon. Same keygen and signing; only the hash changes.

Rust generates all the Cairo test data. Cairo deserializes and checks element-by-element. 27 Cairo tests, 61 Rust tests. https://github.com/feltroidprime/falcon-rs

---

## Post 10
63k steps for verify(), down from 800k on Day 1. -92%.

Next: wiring this into an actual account contract. __validate__ calls verify, public key in storage packed into 29 felt252 slots, signature + hint in calldata. When Blake2s ships in 0.14.2, @zknoxhq's hash-to-point drops in and we move toward spec-compliant Falcon on a live network. Let's see.

| Step | Steps | Source |
|------|-------|--------|
| Day 1 legacy | 824,090 | `falcon_512_steps_legacy.pb.gz` |
| NTT compiler | 390,565 | `..._45e3bcc.pb.gz` |
| Hint-based (0 INTTs) | 159,403 | `..._4158622.pb.gz` |
| u16â†’Zq | 133,245 | `..._a00d9f5.pb.gz` |
| Remove u16/u32 | 117,836 | `..._86f1981.pb.gz` |
| felt252 alloc fix | 98,919 | `..._c0e7510.pb.gz` |
| BInt norm | 91,213 | `..._027e3a9.pb.gz` |
| Fuse sub+normÂ² | 87,606 | `..._5b52758.pb.gz` |
| Fuse compute_norm | 76,295 | `..._f116483.pb.gz` |
| Fuse all single pass | 63,177 | `..._a1f5ed9.pb.gz` |

Every number from a real profile. 824k â†’ 63k = -92%. Draft synced at https://typefully.com/?d=8115504&a=122079
